meanings.definition: In a catatonic manner; characterized by catatonia.
meanings.sent1: She stared catatonically at the wall, not moving a muscle.
meanings.sent2: The patient lay catatonically on the bed, unresponsive to any stimuli.
meanings.sent3: The catatonically still squirrel seemed frozen mid-leap, amusing the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Time stood still as the world moved around her catatonically, like a statue in a bustling city square.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes glazed over, staring catatonically into the distance, lost in her own thoughts.

meanings.definition: In a state of catatonia; exhibiting immobility or stupor.
meanings.sent1: The catatonically frozen expression on his face revealed his inner turmoil.
meanings.sent2: She remained catatonically still, as if turned to stone by the shocking news.
meanings.sent3: The catatonically quiet library was suddenly disrupted by a loud sneeze.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were filled with people moving catatonically, lost in their own worlds.
meanings.sent5: His catatonically rigid posture made him appear like a statue among the bustling crowd.
